summary: This document is a medical letter from the Bone Marrow Transplant Department at the Chaim Sheba Medical Center in Israel regarding HLA typing for a patient named Ariel Taicher, who requires a life-saving stem cell transplant. The letter requests completion of HLA typing for locus C and DQ from the KASHI team and is signed by coordinator Yulia Umansky.

persons.name: Ariel Taicher
persons.context: Mr. Taicher is identified as needing allogeneic stem cell transplantation as a life-saving procedure, with siblings as potential donors.

persons.name: Yulia Umansky
persons.context: Yulia Umansky is the coordinator at the Bone Marrow Transplant Department who signed the letter requesting HLA typing for the patient.

connections.description: Umansky, as the transplant coordinator, is corresponding on behalf of Taicher's medical needs for a stem cell transplant.

events.title: Medical letter requesting HLA typing
events.description: The Bone Marrow Transplant Department at Chaim Sheba Medical Center sends a letter requesting completion of HLA typing for locus C and DQ for patient Ariel Taicher.

locations: The Chaim Sheba Medical Center, Tel-Hashomer 52621, Israel
Tel-Aviv University Sackler School of Medicine
keyFacts: The document is a medical letter dated March 31, 2020, from the Bone Marrow Transplant Department at Chaim Sheba Medical Center in Israel.
It concerns a patient named Ariel Taicher who requires a life-saving allogeneic stem cell transplant.
The letter requests the KASHI team to complete HLA typing for locus C and DQ and send results to the transplant center.
The letter is signed by Yulia Umansky, the Bone Marrow Transplant Coordinator.
This document appears to be unrelated to the Epstein case based on its content, focusing solely on medical treatment for Ariel Taicher.
